meanings.sent1: The pond water was stagnant, not moving at all.
meanings.sent2: The stagnant air in the room made it feel stuffy.
meanings.sent3: The stagnant traffic made everyone late for work.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas remained stagnant, never evolving or growing.
meanings.sent5: The stagnant pool of water was a breeding ground for mosquitoes.

meanings.definition: Showing no activity; dull or sluggish
meanings.sent1: The stagnant market had no new buyers or sellers.
meanings.sent2: His stagnant performance at work led to his dismissal.
meanings.sent3: The party was so stagnant, even the music seemed bored.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt stagnant, lacking any creative spark.
meanings.sent5: The stagnant conversation put everyone to sleep.
